item.title: [ 47] NixOS is literally the best distro out there and nobody can convince me otherwi
item.description:
NixOS is literally the best distro out there and nobody can convince me otherwise. The 4chan hack straight up wouldn't have happened if they were running NixOS. Ghostscript exploit? Would've been sandboxed into oblivion. Immutable config? Untouchable. Reproducible builds? Rolled back in 5 minutes tops. But nah let’s just manually slap shit together like it’s 2003 and hope for the best. Imagine getting pwned because you didn’t feel like writing a 20-line Nix file. Couldn't be me. These people are out here doing devops like cavemen while I’m declaratively vibing. Stay vulnerable I guess.

Original filename: 1736701285925847.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [459] Oblivion Remastered - Good??
item.description:
Never played this when it came out. Playing the remaster now. Why does this game actually BTFO Skyrim?

>actual magic system with some amount of depth
>combat actually feels better than Skyrim? It feels easier to die if you're not properly blocking, enemies actually respond when you hit them etc (might have been an addition of the remaster not sure)
>acrobatics and athletics are awesome and let you feel your character becoming more fit and physically adept as you jump around
>towns feel like they are actual little communities where people know and speak to each other and each has their own unique guild chapters with their own quirks
>joining a guild takes a lot of time and effort and involves a lot of quests that are actually relevant to what the guild is about (ie using actual stealth when assassinating people, using actual magic to become a mage)
>the world is soulful and tranquil, has a feeling of whimsy and serenity that nothing in the genre has matched in recent memory which reminds me of how I looked at classic fantasy as a child
>can customize your own wizard tower and undersea grotto
>Shivering Isles expansion is surreal and feels like a legitimate LSD trip

It's kino. Oblivionchads I kneel.

Original filename: SOVL.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 70] The EU is the next superpower
item.description:
The EU military will be the one ruling the seas
The EU will be the largest consumer market
The EURO will become the new reserve currency
EU bonds will become the new bedrock of the global financial system
People across the world will invest their money in the STOXX 600
Frankfurt will be the new New York
Brussels will be the new DC
Spain will be the new Florida
Ukraine will be the new Great Plains
The Lapland will be the new Alaska

And America will become hopeless, brown and poor

item.title: [ 70] 4chan Android client
item.description:
Can someone please fork and continue development of KurobaEx? It was the only good app I ever found that worked for 4chan and other imageboards. It worked with 8kun, basedjak, lain, all the archives, etc.

The developer was a damn good guy but I think he was Ukrainian and died or got tired of making the app or something.

https://github.com/K1rakishou/Kuroba-Experimental

Captcha: 0ATH

item.title: [156] /cfb/ - Lee Corso, 89
item.description:
>Lee Corso set to Retire from College GameDay
Legendary ESPN analyst Lee Corso, 89, will retire after 38 years on "College GameDay," with his final show on August 30, 2025

>Cam Ward Goes No. 1 in NFL Draft (Titans)
Miami QB Cam Ward was picked No. 1 overall by the Tennessee Titans in the 2025 NFL Draft, lauded for his record-setting 158 career touchdown passes and dual-threat ability

>Travis Hunter Drafted No. 2 Overall (Jags)
Colorado’s two-way star Travis Hunter was selected No. 2 by the Jacksonville Jaguars in the 2025 NFL Draft, praised for his versatility as a cornerback and wide receiver

>Ashton Jeanty’s First-Round Selection (Raiders)
Boise State RB Ashton Jeanty, with 2,601 rushing yards in 2024, was a first-round pick in the 2025 NFL Draft, defying the trend of devalued running backs with his dynamic play.

>Shedeur Sanders’ Draft Slide

item.title: [ 83] /de3/ - DALL-E 3 General
item.description:
Last thread >>105035611

>What is DALL-E 3?
It's a text-to-image generator made by OpenAI.

>Links
https://www.bing.com/images/create
https://designer.microsoft.com/image-creator
https://copilot.microsoft.com/

>Download links for latest Bing and Designer Slop scripts:
https://pastebin.com/raw/bk33MxxG

>Instructions and download for BIC EDIT script:
https://rentry.org/bicedit

>How does it work on Bing?
In Bing's Image Creator, "boosts" are used to speed up the image creation process, each user starts with 15 boosts. When you use a boost, the AI creates your image quickly. If you run out of boosts, the image waiting time can increase, usually if you refresh the page you can get the picture earlier.

>Prompt Generator
https://tipseason.com/dalle-prompt-generator

https://files.catbox.moe/o4yihf.png
https://files.catbox.moe/320rm1.png
https://files.catbox.moe/8gge6o.png
https://files.catbox.moe/dcokjf.png

>Related Boards
>>>/v/dall-e
>>>/co/dall-e
>>>/trash/aibf
>>>/aco/dall
>>>/tg/slop

item.title: [276] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Sunday - Round 8 concludes
item.description:
Sunny days edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Canberra Raiders v Redcliffe Dolphins
2:00pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
GIO Stadium, Canberra
1.51-2.58
>A clash between two of the NRL’s early-season surprise packets awaits as the Raiders aim to continue their surge up the ladder against the in-form Dolphins. Canberra enters round 8 off the back of a 30-20 win over the Titans, which has catapulted them into third place on the ladder with a 5-2 record. The Dolphins are riding a wave of momentum after notching three straight wins. None were more impressive than last week’s 42-22 dismantling of Melbourne. This will be the fourth ever meeting between these sides. In their lone clash last year, the Raiders prevailed 26-25.
Raiders 1-12 2.90
Raiders 13+ 2.60
Dolphins 1-12 3.70
Dolphins 13+ 6.50
Raiders -5.5 1.85 Dolphins +5.5 1.96

>GAME 2
Wests Tigers v Cronulla Sharks
4:05pm AEST on Ch9, Fox and Kayo
Leichhardt Oval, Sydney
2.74-1.46
>Round 8 ends with the NRL return of Lachie Galvin where he made his home debut at Leichhardt Oval in 2024. The Tigers slipped to 12th on the ladder after a 38-22 defeat to Parramatta in a wild Easter Monday showdown. It was a performance full of effort but lacking in execution, continuing a theme of near-misses for Benji Marshall’s outfit. The Sharks have found some rhythm. A convincing 34-14 win over the Knights last week marked back-to-back victories for the second time this season and showcased the attacking spark and defensive structure that have made them a finals threat in recent years. Cronulla has had a stranglehold over this fixture in recent times, winning 11 out of 13. The Tigers did pull off an upset at this very ground last year with a 26 point victory.
Tigers 1-12 3.80
Tigers 13+ 7.25
Sharks 1-12 2.85
Sharks 13+ 2.55
Tigers +6.5 1.90 Sharks -6.5 1.90

SUPER LEAGUE
>GAME 1
Hull FC v Wigan
0:00am (Monday) AEST on Fox and Kayo
4.00-1.24
>The Wigan Warriors look to make it four on the trot as they arrive in Hull for a top of the table clash

Original filename: sunnydayz.jpg

item.title: [ 55] /jpg/ - Japan General
item.description:
Kagura Edition

ー How do I travel by public transportation? ー
Use Google Maps within cities, install the Jorudan or Navitime app for intercity travel

ー What should I see in <place>? ー
https://www.wikivoyage.org/
https://www.japan-guide.com/
https://www.jnto.go.jp/
>Solid general guides - sights, sample itineraries, pre-travel considerations, etc
https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=1fmfaySQHmojbRGKWCwRecq6Ln1Bb2Xdh&ll=35.67928012473078%2C139.68638283648374&z=12
*You should check on google if a place is still in business before you plan to visit it*

ーJR Passー
Since JR has adjusted the prices for the pass, not really worth it anymore, unless you want to travel by train very extensively. You can plug in your itinerary in the links below and compare prices to the JR Pass.
>https://japantravel.navitime.com/en/area/jp/route/
>https://world.jorudan.co.jp/mln/en/
With the increased price of the JR Pass, local train passes might be good deals now.
>https://www.japan-guide.com/e/e2357.html

New prices starting May 2024
>7 day Pass: ¥50,000
>14 day Pass: ¥80,000
>21 day Pass: ¥100,000
https://www.japan-guide.com/railpass/

ーInfo on Degeneracy ー
READ THE INFO LISTED HERE. STOP TALKING ABOUT IT IN THE THREAD.

>https://chn.cityheaven.net/
>https://rockitrisingsun.com
>https://paradise-tokyo.net
>https://hentaitokyo.com
>https://tokyoadultguide.com/

item.title: [ 30] yes another lighter thread
item.description:
Is this the best lighter?
I used to use Clipper, and even though they are refillable, they have worse construction than pic related.
These Bics are pretty damn nice, except you cannot refill them.
Is there a better electric lighter out there? I need something that can withstand temperature fluctuations.
All disposable lighters I've ever used turn into a crack torch in a hot car or barely work when they are cold.
Either way I have to palm it for a few minutes, or put it in my pocket to get a normal flame.

item.title: [181] /out/ings with a pipe
item.description:
Old thread: >>2774508

This is a thread for enjoying a pipe while doing outdoor activities. If you ask why this belongs on /out/, you've never spent an evening by the campfire with a pipe silently enjoying the nature around you, and you're missing out.

>how to get started
Purchase a Missouri Meerschaum Legend and a pouch of Half and Half or Captain Black tobacco, available at most smoke shops. You will need a lighter or match, and something to tamp it with--a large nail works well if you don't have a pipe tool. Fill the pipe with tobacco, pack it down halfway, top it off, pack it down to 3/4, top it off again, pack gently and enjoy. Smoke slower than you think you need to, the tobacco tastes best when it is burning cool. Tamp and re-light as needed. If you still have trouble, try different methods on YouTube until you find one that works for you.

>smoking a pipe will give you cancer
While any tobacco consumption comes with some risk, the cancer risks from occasional pipe use are pretty minimal. Educate yourself and make your own informed health decisions. Some info here https://aacrjournals.org/cancerpreventionresearch/article/10/12/704/46541/Association-between-Cigar-or-Pipe-Smoking-and

>muh weed
Not the time or place. Start your own thread

>I DON’T LIKE WHAT YOU LIKE REEEEEE
Then leave the thread. Pipes have been a part of outdoors culture for centuries. If you don’t like it, leave.

Original filename: 0687fd190525af3678814c5f459c2d0a.jpg
item.author: Anonymous
